intro: Drabopsis verna var. hebecarpa, commonly known as the early spring drab, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe. It typically reaches a height of 5–15 cm and features slender, often hairy stems that bear small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers in early spring, which are followed by elongated, cylindrical seed pods. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Apiaceae family, known for its aromatic foliage and subtle floral display.
